lenders.name: Victoria
lenders.loan_because: I love that I am able to assist KIVA in giving a hand-up and not a hand-out, and to give individuals from a challenging walk-of-life, access to basic banking services, like access to loans, which in turn helps them individually, their family and their communities. I also appreciate, where sometimes women have a lower status in some societies, at KIVA and their partners, they are valued as equals and encouraged to grow personally and professionally. I believe the health of any society in any economy is directly proportional to how healthy, wealthy and happy women are in that society. Helping raise the health, wealth and happiness consciousness of every country, increases our own.

lenders.name: Ben Monarch
lenders.loan_because:
Microfinance provides a dignified and effective means of encouraging entrepreneurialism within emerging economies.  For too long the attitude has been to simply provide handouts, which have (in some cases) bred dependency and demeaned aid recipients.  Microfinance creates an equal partnership between creditor and debtor, which can then be an example to others within emerging economies that if the entrepreneurial spirit is alive then there is a means to finance it.  
Furthermore, microfinance lacks the presumption that loaners-know-best, and instead puts faith in the borrower to apply his or her financing toward a worthy endeavor.  Lastly, microfinance embodies the most admirable quality of capitalism, that being; if someone wishes to improve their way of life they can do so if they try.  Microfinance can provide the world with a new vision for development, and in the process forge bonds which transcend borders and establish that with diligence, goals, and capital we can always make tomorrow better than today.

, Whenever I think here, Xiangku .....

One way in China in recent years of false products and false advertising more and more, China has
A law, "If someone buy products can be double false claims"
I would like to take this a law, the initiative to buy these false product, and then get double pay
, And I have some start-up funds, but these were not enough, I hope you can help

lenders.name: Jon and Heather
lenders.loan_because: While governmental action is crucial to helping end extreme poverty, it alone is not sufficient. Muhammad Yunus has shown us that personal action, through small and seemingly insignificant loans, can and does make a long-term difference in other people's lives. Extreme poverty should not just be accepted as a fact of life, and we believe that this is one way to help in the struggle against poverty.

lenders.name: PinaWongFoundation
lenders.loan_because:
Josefina "Pina" Wong was born on May 31, 1923 in Leon, Nicaragua.  She had a long and fulfilling life which included starting up and running Supermercados Wong, a successful grocery store business with her husband Juan Wong.

In loving memory of Pinita and Juan Wong, their family and friends have come together to start a grass-roots foundation to help struggling families in Latin America and Asia (Pina was 1/2 Chinese and 1/2 Nicaraguan and Juan was 100% Chinese).  We wish to give others the opportunity to "lift themselves by the bootstraps" out of poverty and into more productive, fulfilling lives just like Pina and Juan did... with the help of a small loan!

lenders.name: Victoria
lenders.loan_because: I have been searching for some thing to do to give back. This is some thing I feel strongly about!
lenders.occupational_info: My day to day work is being a home maker and mother. I do sell clothing on E-bay as a way to make extra money.

lenders.name: Sean & Sawyer
lenders.loan_because: We can and its fun.  I'm teaching my 7 year old son Sawyer about philanthropy...
lenders.occupational_info: I am a practicioner of the gentle art of teaching people about the joy they can derive from charitable giving.  I'm with the Community Environmental Council in Santa Barbara, California.  The CEC is a 38 year old environmental non-profit focused on energy efficiency and renewables, alternative transportation, peak oil and climate change. Our goal is to reduce the community’s carbon footprint by ending our region’s dependency on fossil fuels in one generation- Fossil Free by ’33!

lenders.name: Jesie

lenders.name: Ramon
lenders.occupational_info:
I am working as an Account Manager (small business) for the Rabobank
Key Accountabilities / Activities:
To relationship manage a portfolio of small business customers by meeting the total banking needs of the customer, both personal and business. The portfolio will primarily contain small business customers whose business needs are generally straightforward. Typical small businesses managed at this level would include: small to medium sized agriculture operations; small to medium sized franchises; businesses with one or two locations; many professionals and small trades. Meet the personal needs of these small business customers, which may range from simple to complex, by profiling, referring, promoting, selling, cross-selling, up selling and delivering a full range of personal banking products and services, including several sophisticated products.

In the past I've done lots of different jobs from cleaning toilets to teaching English to selling wedding dresses and I've just set up my own business as a Fine Art Model - quite a change from my last job! My most important job however will always be raising my son - he's a great kid and I am very proud of him.
